name: Osteria Alle Testiere
description: Tiny, intimate restaurant serving exceptional seafood. One of Venice's best-kept secrets with only 24 seats.
tips: Book weeks in advance. Try the tasting menu. Cash only.

name: Cantina Do Mori
description: Historic bacaro dating back to 1462. Perfect for cicchetti and local wines in an authentic setting.
tips: Stand at the bar like locals. Try the polpette and baccalà. Very small, can get crowded.

name: Gelateria Nico
description: Famous for their gianduiotto - hazelnut gelato with whipped cream. Enjoy by the Giudecca Canal.
tips: Get the gianduiotto and sit by the water. Best at sunset. Cash only.

name: Gallerie dell'Accademia
description: Premier collection of Venetian art from 14th-18th centuries. Home to works by Titian, Tintoretto, and Bellini.
tips: Book online to skip lines. Allow 2-3 hours. Photography not allowed.

name: Teatro La Fenice
description: Historic opera house rebuilt after fires. Stunning interiors with world-class performances.
tips: Book opera tickets months ahead. Daytime tours available. Dress code for evening performances.

name: Mercato di Rialto
description: Historic food market with fresh fish, produce, and local specialties. A feast for the senses.
tips: Open mornings only (7AM-1PM). Tuesday-Saturday. Best before 10AM.

name: Venetian Artisan Workshops
description: Discover traditional Venetian crafts: masks, marbled paper, glasswork in small family workshops.
tips: Look for 'fatto a mano' (handmade) signs. Ask to watch artisans work. Prices negotiable.

name: Giardini della Biennale
description: Public gardens hosting the Venice Biennale art exhibitions. Peaceful green space away from crowds.
tips: Free to walk gardens. Biennale entrance requires ticket. Nice picnic spot.

name: Redentore Festival
description: Historic festival (3rd Saturday of July) with fireworks, boats, and celebrations across the lagoon.
tips: Book restaurant/boat early. Best views from Giudecca. Bring blankets for outdoor viewing.

name: Trattoria Antiche Carampane
description: Hidden restaurant serving authentic Venetian cuisine. No tourist menus, just real local food.
tips: Hard to find (no sign). Reservation essential. Try the seppie al nero.

name: All'Arco
description: Tiny bacaro near Rialto with creative cicchetti and excellent wine selection. Standing room only.
tips: Arrive before noon or after 6PM. Cash only. Try everything they recommend.

name: Scuola Grande di San Rocco
description: Stunning building filled with Tintoretto's masterpieces. Often overlooked but absolutely worth visiting.
tips: Use the mirrors provided to view ceiling paintings. Audio guide recommended.

name: Fondaco dei Tedeschi Rooftop
description: Free rooftop terrace with 360° views of Venice. Book time slot online. Shopping mall below.
tips: Free but must book online. 15-minute time slots. Best at sunset.

name: Venice Jazz Club
description: Intimate jazz venue with live performances. Great atmosphere and reasonable drink prices.
tips: Check schedule online. Small venue fills quickly. Cover charge includes one drink.

name: Pasticceria Tonolo
description: Traditional Venetian bakery famous for their frittelle during Carnival and excellent pastries year-round.
tips: Go early for best selection. Try the zaletti cookies. Standing room only.
